title: To the Eumenides
lines: Hear me and be gracious, O renowned Eumenides, O pure daughters of the great Chthonic Zeus and of lovely Persephone, fair-tressed maiden.
Over the lives of impious mortals you keep a careful eye, in charge of Necessity, you punish the unjust.
Black-skinned queens, your awesome eyes flash forth flesh-eating darts of light.

Everlasting, repugnant, frightful, sovereign, paralyzing the limbs with madness, hideous, nocturnal, fateful, snake-haired, terrible maidens of the night, it is you I summon to bring me holiness of mind.
